prefix.description: View all the available custom commands by using the e!help custom command.

description: Custom commands are a way to create your own commands for Wynem. Users can run a custom command and Wynem will respond with a customised message that you create.

data.title: Custom command!
data.description: You just ran a custom command!

description: There are multiple different types of custom command that you can set up. Each one replies with a different type of message.

rows: Wynem will reply with a regular Discord message
Will send an image, gif, or a video in chat
Reply with your own custom embed that can look however you want
Will send a message containing some clickable URL buttons

guides.name: Creating Custom Commands
content: To start setting up your own custom commands, first run the e!addcustomcommand/serverconfig customcommands addcustomcommand command, and then click the button to start.

data.description: Press the button to start creating a custom command

content:
Next, a modal will appear, where you can enter the information for the custom command.
Fill in this modal and then click submit. Only the first field is required.

data.title: Custom Command Builder
rows: The name of the custom command
the description of the custom command

content: You will then be given a choice of what type of custom command you want to create. Pick a type.

data.description: What type of custom command would you like to create?
fields: Will send a regular Discord message
Will send an image/gif/video in chat
Will send a message containing some URL buttons

tabs.name: Message
content: You will be presented with a button to add the custom command's message. Press it to continue.

data.description: Press the button to add the custom command's message

content: A modal will appear where you can enter the message. Enter in your message and then submit it.

tabs.name: Image/Gif/Video
content: You will be presented with a button to add the custom command's message. Press it to continue.

data.description: Press the button to add the custom command's image/gif/video

content: A modal will appear where you can enter the image/gif/video URL. Enter in your URL and then submit it.

tabs.name: Custom Embed
content: The custom embeds option will start the custom embed builder. For a guide on creating custom embeds, check out the Custom Embed feature.

tabs.name: URL Buttons
content: You will be presented with a button to add the custom command's URL buttons. Press it to continue.

data.description: Press the button to add the custom command's URL buttons

content:
You will be able to add up to 25 buttons to your custom command.
Buttons are special links that appear in a message.

There are 5 rows of buttons, which support up to 5 buttons each.
You must have at least 1 button on a row to have another row.
Skipping the first button in a row will skill all remaining buttons, whereas skipping any other button will skip the rest of the current row.

rows: The text that is displayed on the button.
The URL to go to when you click on the button.

data.title: URL Button Builder
rows: The URL to go to when clicking the button

content: After adding each button, you will be given the option to add the next button, skip the current row, or move to the next row. Choose what you want to do to continue.

data.description: Press a button to continue adding URL buttons

content: You are finished! Your custom command has been created and is now active and ready for you to use!

guides.name: Running Custom Commands
content: To run a custom command, simply run the command e![customcommandname]. For example: e!example/customcommand command:[customcommandname]. For example: /customcommand command:example

guides.name: Removing Custom Commands
content: To remove custom command, start by running the command e!removecustomcommand [customcommandname]. For example: e!removecustomcommand example/serverconfig customcommands removecustomcommand command:[customcommandname]. For example: /serverconfig customcommands removecustomcommand command:example You will be prompted to confirm that you want to remove the custom command. Press remove to continue.

data.description:
This action will remove the `example` command

Are you sure you want to continue?

content: After confirming, the custom command will have been removed.
